text: (upbeat techno music)
- Hello.
I'm Akrati, a Cloud Support Engineer

here at the AWS Office
in Bengaluru, India.

Today I'm going to show
you what you can do
if your CPU credit balance suddenly drops
for your Amazon EC2 T2 instance.
Let's get started.
A sudden drop in T2 CPU credit balance
without a corresponding sudden increase

in CPU credit utilization,
can be the result

of the instance being
stopped and then relaunched.

If you notice a sudden
drop in CPU credits,

confirm that the EC2 T2
instance was relaunched

around the time of the
credit balance drop.
As you can see, I'm already logged
into the AWS Management Console.

Now I'll navigate to
the Amazon EC2 console.

From the Amazon EC2
console, choose instance

from the left navigation
pane, choose the T2 instance,
choose the description box below,

and then look for the
launch date and time.
This process confirms that the drop

in the T2 CPU credit balance,
corresponds to the time
the EC2 T2 instance was relaunched.

Thanks for watching and
happy cloud computing,
from all of us here at AWS.
(upbeat techno music)
